column4: Savik, if you are using any sort of GUI you either have xserver-xorg or XFree86
the xubuntu-desktop is a bit flaky. The xfce4-panel crashed unexpectedly while I was using it, and when I reloaded it, everything was in the wrong place
ANYTHING IN LINUX THAT IS GUI BASED REQUIRES X TO BE RUNNING TO WORK
ease up on the caps, OK?
there are several ops present. Kovecses cool it, OK?
mind the caps, OK? 2nd & last warning...
nonsense, there's a nice BSOD screensaver! :)
AFAIK there is no #ubuntu-anarchy... there might be an #anarchy channel
why do people like that exist?
my ATI 9600XT objects to your joke ;)
like I said not a big fan of ati

I don't know if this is your department, but would you mind checking the cd image for the 64 bit version of ubuntu on the website, I have someone saying that the installer isn't working properly complaining about a missing font file, the guy appears to know what he is talking about, and insists the cd selfcheck returned no errors
not my department at all - file a bug @ bugs.ubuntu.com
